revised_title: Resonating Waterfalls: A Study of Oscillations in Water Sheets
tldr: This article explores the oscillations and resonating waterfalls that occur when a thin sheet of water falls vertically into a pool. The authors use stroboscopy to study the modes and frequencies of these oscillations and develop a theory to explain the observed phenomena. They find that surface friction and air drag play a significant role in determining the mode and frequency of oscillations.
